channel.title: A way to fully convert this?

item.title: A way to fully convert this?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

That is one animation, you could be mistaking anim for gfx

animation(animID);

and you don’t need to make it go outside the player it will do that on its own if you have the correct gfx set

Read full topic
item.source: A way to fully convert this?

item.title: A way to fully convert this?
item.dc:creator: @blo0d_pker blo0d pker
item.description:
@blo0d_pker wrote:

Here’s what i’m trying to get at…
You know if a player in runescape has the curse ‘Wrath’ activated, on death you will see a white explosion-like cloud and it spreads around the player. That is what I am trying to do, but If I use just the gfx100 it will just cause the gfx to perform underneath the player. What I was trying to do, is make it perform around the player by adding on to or subtracting from the player position, causing the ‘Wrath’ curse to perform like so, in Runescape.

Read full topic
item.source: A way to fully convert this?

item.title: A way to fully convert this?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

that’s why your getting errors, sigh

You could just do

if ((c.absX) && (c.absY)) {
// emote
}

item.title: A way to fully convert this?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Well… Here.

public void gfx100(int gfx, int absX, int absY) {
    mask100var1 = gfx;
    mask100var2 = 6553600;
    mask100update = true;
    updateRequired = true;
}
